cont.entity_a: Brews one cup every 60 seconds using hot tap water to reduce brew time. Brews 55 cups or less in reasonable time. Brew time is at least 50 minutes to 1 hour.
cont.entity_b: Brews enough for two real-sized cups quickly. Brews quickly with a good taste. Brews 2.5 cups, suitable for single-person use.

cont.entity_a: Noisy when starting, but quiets down once perking.
Attractive design and easy to use. Overall poor fit, feel, and finish.
Minimal grounds in the bottom. Directions advise against using a coffee filter, but too many grounds get through.
cont.entity_b: Makes coffee hotter than Keurig. Plastic taste noticed in coffee.
Reusable filter recommended for cost savings.

cont.entity_a: Leaked after two months of use and return period lapsed. Second unit leaked immediately upon use despite careful storage. Made of thin aluminum, which may be dangerous due to heat transmission. Interior corrosion observed due to poor aluminum quality. Leaks near the handle during brewing. Reliable and durable with multiple units lasting several years.
cont.entity_b: Stopped working after one year of use.
Decanter drips when pouring from a full pot. Carafe drips when pouring.

cont.entity_a: Heats contents quickly, posing burn risk.
Interior cup level is a helpful feature. Cord is long and non-detachable. Metal coffee filter becomes hot during use. Logo is painted, not etched.
cont.entity_b: Keep warm function lasts one hour. Programmable with auto shut-off. Delay brew function available. Auto shut-off after one hour. Clock is difficult to read. Lid warps over time, affecting function.

cont.entity_a: Received compliments from friends and suitable for gatherings. Suitable for large venues and frequent use. Used frequently without issues over extended periods.

cont.entity_b: Lid closes properly when snap is used.
